headline: Computer Forensics Analyst with Homeland Security Investigations
summary: Facilitates the forensic acquisition and examination of computer related equipment, cellular devices, and other devices used by suspects in criminal investigations. Works with agencies across the United States in ensuring that evidence is processed swiftly and accurately by using the most up to date technology and software available which includes ADF, Magnet IEF and Axiom, Cellebrite, Forensic Explorer, Oxygen and FTK.

defaultPosition.description: Facilitates the forensic acquisition and examination of computer related equipment, cellular devices, and other devices used by suspects in criminal investigations. Works with agencies across the United States in ensuring that evidence is processed swiftly and accurately by using the most up to date technology and software available.
defaultPosition.title: Computer Forensic Analyst

positions.description: Facilitates the forensic acquisition and examination of computer related equipment, cellular devices, and other devices used by suspects in criminal investigations. Works with agencies across the United States in ensuring that evidence is processed swiftly and accurately by using the most up to date technology and software available.
positions.title: Computer Forensic Analyst

positions.description: Intern participating in the H.E.R.O. program which led to being A+ certified, trained in the use of various forensic software to include Nuix, Cellebrite, Oxygen Forensics, Encase and Access Data FTK, trained in identification procedures of criminal acts, suspects, and the victims involved in crimes.
positions.title: H.E.R.O. Intern

positions.description:
â¢	Planned, coordinated, and allocated over 160 vehicles in support of logistical movement of personnel and equipment at Joint Base Lewis-McChord. 
â¢	Supervised the maintenance and repair of more than 160 various pieces of equipment to include semi-trucks, trailers, forklifts, and misc equipment. 
â¢	Overall responsible for equipment valued in excess of $13,000,000.00. 
â¢	Ensured insured initial training and sustainment training on all equipment was performed in a timely manner. 
â¢	Applied Composite Risk Management practices daily in order to reduce risks associated with moving large amounts of goods and equipment through high density population areas.
positions.title: Truckmaster

positions.description:
â¢	Utilized Team building skills to build a tight knit, cohesive squad of 15 diverse Soldiers together and deploy them to 3 Theatres of Operations during a time of conflict. 
â¢	Trained my squad in the concept of Composite Risk Management which resulted in no injuries or loss of life. 
â¢	Experienced Leader that communicates effectively in high stress situations and as result accomplishes tasks in an efficient and timely manner. 
â¢	Utilized every Soldiers strengths in a positive manner and identified their weaknesses and introduced methods to strengthen them.
positions.title: Squad Leader

positions.description:
â¢	Ensured the safety of Soldiers and civilians by providing security in the transport of goods and equipment across Kuwait, Iraq, and Afghanistan during a time of conflict.
â¢	 Managed the loading and unloading of goods and equipment. 
â¢	Utilized Composite Risk Management in order to reduce risks and as a result had no injuries or loss life of either Soldiers or civilians.
positions.title: Convoy Escort Team Commander
